name: Morristown National Historical Park
description: Morristown National Historical Park commemorates the sites of General Washington and the Continental Army’s winter encampment from December 1779 to June 1780, where soldiers survived the coldest winter on record. The park also maintains a museum and library collection related to the encampments and to George Washington, as well as items from both pre- and post-Revolutionary America.
shortDescription: Morristown National Historical Park commemorates the sites of General Washington and the Continental Army’s winter encampment from December 1779 to June 1780, where soldiers survived the coldest winte...

operatingHours.description:
Washington's Headquarters Museum: Open Thursday-Sunday 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM.
Jockey Hollow Visitor Center: Open Thursday-Sunday 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

climate.weatherDescription: Weather in this part of New Jersey is typical of the mid-Atlantic region--a humid continental climate with hot, humid summers and moderately cold winters.

images.title: Wick House
images.altText: The Wick House surrounded by colorful fall leaves
images.caption: The Wick House in the fall.

images.title: Washington's Headquarters Museum
images.altText: The front facade of the Washington's Headquarters Museum
images.caption: The front facade of the Washington's Headquarters Museum, which was designed in 1933 to look similar to Washington's Mt Vernon home.

images.title: Replica Soldier Huts in Jockey Hollow
images.altText: Four replica wooden soldier huts on a hillside in winter
images.caption: These replica soldier huts represent the location of the Pennsylvania Brigade encampment site in Jockey Hollow

images.title: Cross Estate Mansion and Gardens
images.altText: The Cross Estate mansion in the springtime
images.caption: The Cross Estate property was the site of the New Jersey Brigade winter encampement in 1779-1780. Today the encampment site is preserved while the estate is host to several beautiful gardens.

images.title: Jockey Hollow Visitor Center
images.altText: View of the front facede of the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center--a dark brown brick buildings
images.caption: View of the front facade of the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center

images.title: Wick House Kitchen Garden
images.altText: Garden with flowers and plants and 18th century farm house in background
images.caption: A 18th century style kitchen garden with vegetables and herbs

images.title: Ford Mansion with Washington Statue
images.altText: White georgian/colonial building with statue of officer on horse in foreground
images.caption: The Ford Mansion where General Washington headquartered during the winter of 1779-80

images.title: View from Fort Nonsense
images.caption: Fort Nonsense--the site of an earthen fort during the American Revolution-offers a view toward New York City

images.title: Ford Mansion
images.altText: A white colonial building with snow in the foreground and a blue sky and trees in the background
images.caption: The Ford Mansion was the headquarters for General George Washington during the "Hard Winter" of 1779-1780
